JobFullDesc:
The company:
At Datadog, we’re on a mission to build the best monitoring platform in the world. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—providing always-on alerting, metrics visualization, logs, and application tracing for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way.
 
The opportunity:
You’re the zero to one person. You know how to talk to customers before you have product market fit, and find product market fit. You thrive on ambiguity, a fast pace, and wear multiple hats. Your days will be spent doing everything from triaging tasks with engineers for a beta launch, pitching customers based on an alpha demo, to working with our data visualization and design teams on new UX concepts, and writing specs for a major feature of the GA product.
Your job will be to make big bets with a small, highly skilled team, to unlock the next big business for Datadog.
 
You will:

Learn everything about monitoring (theory, applications, best practices) and pour it back into building a great product.
Talk to highly technical customers about their monitoring, listen to their needs, and work with the team to solve their problems.
Lead a cross-functional team of product managers, product designers, engineers, and analysts to identify and execute on levers to achieve product-market fit for new initiatives
Scope, spec, and design new features, working with executives, designers, and engineers.
Balance many factors (market, customers, team) to prioritize which work we do and which we defer.
Grow to understand our users (software developers, ops engineers) deeply; design solutions they find intuitive and delightful.

 
Requirements:

You have a proven track record of building new features from scratch ideally at a SaaS company.
You enjoy and can eloquently speak with highly technical customers.
You get things done and are motivated by the impact your actions have around you.
You have a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent.
